```{r}
# Horizontal Example

# Load the plotrix package
library(plotrix)
 
# Create a data frame with some example data
df <- data.frame(
  group = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C", "C"),
  value = c(10, 12, 8, 9, 6, 7)
)
 
# Calculate the means and standard errors for each group
means <- aggregate(value ~ group, data = df, FUN = mean)
stderrs <- aggregate(value ~ group, data = df, 
                     FUN = function(x) sd(x) / sqrt(length(x)))
 
# Create a dot chart of the data
dotchart(means$value, labels = means$group, xlim = c(0, max(means$value) * 1.1),
         xlab = "Value")
 
# Add error bars representing the standard error of the mean
arrows(
  x0 = means$value - stderrs$value,
  y0 = 1:length(means$group),
  x1 = means$value + stderrs$value,
  y1 = 1:length(means$group),
  angle = 90,
  code = 3,
  length = 0.1
)
```

```{r}
# Horizontal Error Bars
# Example from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51344297/r-scatter-plot-with-confident-intervals

library(ggplot2)

df <- data.frame(method = LETTERS[1:3],
                 est = c(5.7, 6, 5.9),
                 lower = c(5.2, 5.5, 5.6),
                 upper = c(5.8, 6.4, 6.1))

ggplot(df, aes(x = est, y = method)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_errorbarh(aes(xmin = lower, xmax = upper)) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = 5.75), colour = "red") 
```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)
attach(Regression_output)

df <- data.frame(outcome = Variables,
                 CI=c(-0.000328685, 0.708255933, 0.735728177, 1.404083229, 0.28294962, 0.109937814 , 0.389363066, 0.219342642, 0.935351514, 1.440720904, 2.06994017, 1.435434142, 1.370114042, 1.079259465, 1.460878619, 1.260331049, 1.199890136),
                 lower=LowerLimit,
                 upper=UpperLimit)
testing <- ggplot(df, aes(x=CI, y=outcome)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_errorbarh(aes(xmin=lower, xmax=upper))
print(testing)
```
